properties.name: A City Dedicated to Commerce!
properties.description: Posted by WildgiftThe City of Commerce was incorporated as a clever tax dodge by the business owners in an unincorporated part of Imaginary County. In their early years, they boasted that their Lacuna Towers were "the tallest buildings east of the LA River and west of the Pomona Valley." They were technically incorrect because building heights include the radio antennas on top, and others had them, but at 18 stories, it was very tall and nobody disputed it. In 1975, crosstown civic rivals, The City of Industry, attempted to steal away the "tallest building" title with their Turnbull Tower, which was 19 stories tall. Commerce retaliated by quietly erecting a 40 foot-tall radio tower on the Lacuna, and hired a Berlin artist to attach illuminated plastic hologram panels to it, so it would resemble a solid, lit structure. They just as quietly stopped mentioning the "tallest building" title when high winds knocked the tower down, into the adjacent electric substation, causing a small fire that cut power to the entire city.

properties.name: Belmont Shore Pier
properties.description: Posted by BaostarOcean and 39th, Belmont Shore, CABelmont Shore is a distinct area of Long Beach, stretching along 2nd Street and Ocean Avenue on the southern most end of the city. It has its own shopping district, business association, pier and recreation center with the landmark Belmont Pool where an Olympic gold medalist has taught swim lessons for years. Several thousand residents consider this quaint and quirky community a city unto itself and at one time, it actually was a separate city. In 1906, it took shape as the fastest growing subdivision in Long Beach and was called Belmont Heights. Originally designed as an Italian-styled city running along canals, developers Frank Shaw & George C. Flint scrapped plans because of cost and logistics. Another nearby community, Naples, did become the Italian styled village, offering houses on canals, a promenade with a large fountain and even gondoliers. All Belmont wanted was a pier. In 1908, angry residents of Belmont Heights voted to become the City of Belmont. Fed up over high taxes imposed by the City of Long Beach, they decided they could do better on their own. During its brief period as a city, Belmont determined that its residents could not afford what they wanted even more than tax reductions. So just one year later they voted to rejoin Long Beach with the understanding a pier would be built. Belmont got its pier in 1915 and the charming community built its lifestyle around its prized possession and sandy beaches surrounding it. The current pier was built in 1966, replacing a wooden pier that stood for over 50 years. The 1,620 foot-long concrete pier has experienced structural damage and needs revamping. New restrooms will be added to the mid section of the pier and enhancements such as lighting and electrical updating is expected to bring more activity to the region. The pier is located at Ocean and 39th Place. It offers free public fishing with no license required as long as you stay on the pier to fish. Pay parking is available in a public lot near the base of the pier.

properties.name: Bistango
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 19100 Von Karman Ave Ste 100, Irvine, CAWide-open atrium in the middle of an upscale office building. A colorful art collection changes every three months. Crowd: Everybody from business people to the international jet set. Serves contemporary American cuisine. Linguini with clams, penne with marinated chicken breast, crab cakes, Nicoise salad with seared fresh tuna on frisee lettuce, tuna tartare with a spicy chili vinaigrette, oven-roasted halibut, venison, grilled rack of lamb in port wine sauce. The filet mignon and New York steak are superb. There\'s always something going on here, including live entertainment nightly. Wine tastings on Wednesdays; Champagne tastings on Thursdays. Full bar, 300 selections on well-varied wine list.

properties.name: Black Sheep Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 303 El Camino Real, Tustin, CA, 92780Some of Orange County\'s most exciting kitchens are tucked in quiet little corners far away from the beaches and shopping centers. This restaurant is a shining example. It\'s located in downtown Tustin, an area only otherwise known for its sleepy historic charm and Wednesday farmers market. Thanks to stellar word-of-mouth and perennial critical acclaim, it\'s become a destination restaurant -- not just for Tustin residents and their neighbors, but for foodies from far and wide. Chef/owner Rick Boufford is an ebullient, outgoing character, while his wife and business partner Diana is the quiet force behind the scenes. They\'re both world travelers with a passion for food. Their ever-evolving menu reflects this. Many of the recipes come from the Catalan regions of France, Italy and Spain, while others evince more diverse, hard-to-pinpoint influences. Boufford\'s signature "Four Seasons" preparation actually consists of four different sauces. Guests can choose whatever meat they want, but most people opt for lamb. The adjacent market sells imported delicacies as well as Black Sheep sauces, pre-made dinners and specialty items. Black Sheep\'s Paella on the Patio Wednesdays are also back. -- Lena Katz

properties.name: Blaze Interactive web design in California
properties.description: Posted by NirzSanta AnaBlaze Interactive is a full-service web design and development firm in California. We provide website design, flash interactive, e-commerce solutions, graphic design, corporate video, web advertisements, photography, and search engine submission to a wide spectrum of clients. Our services integrate creative design and powerful technical skills, grounded in a solid understanding of business practices and a customer-centric development philosophy. We invite you to explore examples of our stellar WORK to see the winning solutions that we have provided for our customers.

properties.name: Blizzard Entertainment HQ
properties.description: Posted by Baostar P.O. Box 18979, Irvine, CA 92623Blizzard Entertainment is an American PC game developer and publisher. Since its release of Warcraft in 1994, it has been one of the most successful game development studios in the world. The company has a history of largely overshooting release dates. However, many Blizzard fans see this as somewhat of a blessing in disguise, as Blizzard has a reputation for producing classic games that are played for years to come. Every one of their games since Warcraft has been a best-seller.

properties.name: Bolsa Chica State Beach
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  huntington beach caBolsa Chica State Beach is just across from the beautifully preserved Bolsa Chica Wetlands. The beach is a nice family spot, even offering overnight camping. Fire rings are spaced all along the beach, and there are concession stands and recreational equipment rentals available. The sand beach itself is quite wide and clean, and the waves are not huge but suffice for a little body boarding.

properties.name: Bridge at Bolsa Chica
properties.description: Posted by BaostarPCH between Warner and Seacli, Huntington Beach, CAWhen you walk the wooden bridge over the saltwater marsh, you find yourself in the company of various bird species and folks who enjoy watching and photographing them. While you can still hear the cars buzzing up and down PCH, no other sounds of civilization are audible. It’s just you and others like you, the dark-blue, softly rolling marsh waters and the birds. It’s a good spot to get into a meditative state.

properties.name: Brodard Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  9892 Westminster Ave., Suite R, Garden Grove, CA 92844 Vietnamese restaurant known for its spring rolls, freshly made by an assembly line of women in open view of diners. The lines at the takeout counter prove that everyone in Little Saigon knows Brodard is the place for spring rolls, perhaps best described to gringos as salad rolls of meat, lettuce, mint, cucumber and other fresh veggies wrapped in translucent rice paper. Brodard makes five kinds of the fresh rolls: You can get the standard, ubiquitous fresh shrimp and sliced pork version here, but the house specialties are more worth your time -- the Nem Nuong Cuon, featuring nem, sweet grilled Vietnamese sausage (referred to as a pork cake or paste) and a crispy fried leek, and the Chao Tom Cuon, with a grilled shrimp cake ("paste") rather than fresh shrimp. An order of 3 hearty rolls runs about .75. Also recommended: The roasted duck salad (.95), numerous versions of bun (another salad-like dish of rice noodles, lettuce and carrots topped with meat or seafood and tangy sauce), and banh xeo, a pan-fried crispy rice-flour crepe flavored with coconut milk and stuffed with shrimp, sliced pork and bean sprouts (.25).

properties.name: Buca Di Beppo
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 13390 Jamboree Rd., Irvine, CA, 92602Description: Goodfellas lounge-y hangout. A mazelike warren of rooms that all look like parts of an Italian restaurant in Brooklyn. No Sopranos on the sound system, but lotsa Sinatra. Black and white photos on the walls are straight out of somebody\'s high school yearbook, circa 1959. Crowd: Funsters of all ages. It\'s a really cute place to take a date, grandma or business associates. Food: Think big. The Southern Italian fare includes hefty portions of spaghetti and meatballs, chicken cacciatore, eggplant parmigiana and jumbo pizzas. Tiramisu, birthday cake and cannolis for dessert.

properties.name: Cafe Pasquini
properties.description: Posted by Baobot  3333 Bristol Street, Costa Mesa, CA, 92626The "oasis" of South Coast Plaza, an in-mall bistro, with counter service and a deli case filled with luscious baked goods. The famous Pasquini cappuccino machines are very much in evidence. Lots of tables and chairs, and a warm, inviting aura. The crowd is shoppers and mall employees, stopping for a bit of refreshment and relaxation. The best cappucino in America, beautiful cakes, cookies and pastries are only the beginning at this little haven of all things Italian - and the values are over-the-top. Daily specials like mussel pasta with tomato sauce, grilled chicken stuffed with spinach, roast veal and pasta with fresh tomato sauce, olive oil and basil are just a few examples of the delectables you might find on the agenda here. Pizza is excellent here, and the salads are very filling. All pastas are homemade; stop in on a Friday for the ethereal gnocchi. Beer and wine are served; the wine selection is very, very good. Pasquini\'s is South Coast Plaza\'s friendliest restaurant, a landmark for more than 20 years amidst the boutiques that come and go. In a perfect world, there would be table service here. But the counter service works for them, and they do an overwhelming amount of business every day. It\'s a family-run business, augmented by the presence of the magnificent Angelo Capello, who Orange County diners will remember from the heyday of the Westin South Coast Plaza Hotel\'s gone-but-not-forgotten Alfredo\'s. Capello is alive and well and at the helm here. Stop in and say hi to him.

properties.name: Cafe Tu Tu Tango
properties.description: Posted by Baobot  20 City Boulevard, Orange, CA, 92868The scene\'s happening and the crowd is cute at this cool, artsy hangout on the Block at Orange. Outside the patio is usually busy no matter what month it is. Girls defiantly sport short black skirts even in the middle of December. Inside the restaurant is warm and busy. The spacious brick building is completely hidden by scores of original paintings. Many of Orange County\'s would-be artists are invited to use the space, not only as a gallery, but also as an open studio. Feel free to watch the artist at work, but stay far enough back that he won\'t splash ochre on your Dockers. Dining here is highly enjoyable and not at all expensive. Everything on the menu is an appetizer portion, but the chefs aren\'t stingy with the food. A signature appetizer is the antipasto platter, which includes Parma ham and some wonderful anchovy-tinged tapenade. It\'s large enough to be a meal for two. The Tango salad is also quite good. It features chunks of mildly flavored, chunky house-smoked salmon. Cajun chicken egg rolls are spicy on their own, but once you dip them in the accompanying Creole mustard -- look out. To drink, order a glass of red or white sangria. -- Lena Katz

properties.name: Cedar Creek Inn
properties.description: Posted by Baobot  20 Pointe Dr., Brea, CA, United StatesCasual; live jazz entertainment; business clientele.

properties.name: Cerritos Center for the Performing Arts
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 12700 Center Court Dr., Cerritos, CA, United StatesThe Cerritos Center for the Performing Arts, (CCPA) is the Southland\'s premier performing arts and conference facility, offering great performances in music, dance and theater and unique facilities for meetings, banquets and special events. Owned and operated by the City of Cerritos, CCPA presents an annual season from August through May. The schedule, which includes over 150 performances, consists of an eclectic mix of artists. CCPA has been host to performances by Frank Sinatra, Whitney Houston, Clint Black, The Chieftains, Kathleen Battle, the Dance Theater of Harlem, the Royal Shakespeare Company and many others. The Cerritos Center for the Performing Arts features a flexible theater capable of six different seating and stage configurations, ranging from a 1,800-seat arena theater to a 900-seat recital hall setting. In addition, the Sierra Conference Center is the perfect setting for banquets, parties or special events. The Mojave Room offers space for club meetings and small receptions. The CCPA and all of its facilities are available for rental. ---www.cerrtoscenter.com

properties.name: Chanticlair
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 18912 MacArthur Blvd., Irvine, CA, 92612A landmark in Orange County since the early 1970\'s, Chanticlair is all charm and warmth in a freestanding country French chateau-like building, with cuisine to match. Several owners have come and gone in recent years; current operator George Kookootsedes once presided over John Dominis, worked for Bob Burns and has been in the restaurant business since shortly after the Korean War. The bar is a popular watering hole for corporate types, and General Manager Bill Blank is a wine expert who was long in residence with Twin Palms in Newport Beach. Blank has concentrated on service, a primary reason the bar crowd has made its way back to this pretty, cozy place. Chanticlair boasts several private dining rooms, six working fireplaces and fresh flowers throughout. And now Chef Felipe Venegas has updated the menu to include a rack of lamb that\'s so tender only the bones come back when the plates are bussed. Old favorites like Chilean seabass and grilled halibut in buerre blanc with mushroom risotto are still menu staples. For those who are looking for tableside preparation of steak Diane and chateaubriand, you\'ll find them here. Some desserts are also prepared tableside; bananas Foster and cherries jubilee are hard to resist.

properties.name: Cliff's Ragin' Cajun
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 2626 Dupont Dr., Irvine, CA, 92612Cliff\'s Ragin\' Cajun started in the Plaza de Cafe Newport Beach in 1993 and quickly became a favorite lunch place for local business persons. Chef Cliff Huffstetler found it necessary to come in earlier and earlier to keep up with the lines of customers. He has also been a guest chef at such places as the L.A. House of Blues and California Culinary Academy in San Francisco. A second Cliff\'s opened in Fountain Valley in 1998. In 1999 Cliff moved on, entering the corporate world as an executive chef for Sodexho Marriott. But now Cliff is back in Irvine at the Jamboree Promenade -- behind the Daily Grill on Jamboree Blvd. at Dupont Road.

properties.name: Coast to Coast Business Equip
properties.description: Posted by System8 Vanderbilt, Irvine, CACoast to Coast Business Equip (949) 457-7300

properties.name: Colorful Urban Condominiums
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 2100 Scholarship, Irvine, CA 92612A new. colorful, mid-rised condominiums community called Avenue One. Nearby are also the Marquee Park Place high-risers, overlooking central Irvine with plenty of business towers and street traffic to boot.

properties.name: Corner Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 3333 Bristol, Costa Mesa, CA, 92626Push a tray and go thru a cafeteria line to select food. No table service. The generous selection of foods here is pre-prepared and displayed in a case, and breads are on a rack behind the cash register. You pick up a tray and point as you go along, and counterpeople will fill your tray with goodies. If it\'s takeaway food you\'re wanting, this is also a great place for it. The Corner Bakery will pack you a picnic lunch to go, or a more elaborate takeaway spread for the group of you heading to Verizon Amphitheatre. Chicken pesto sandwiches are always a good bet for picnics -- try the Lunch Boxes, which come packed with the sandwich of your choice, plus chips, an apple and one of the Bakery\'s delicious cookies. For sit-down meals, the place always seems to be jumping with business people, young couples and seniors; a wide variety of people, all enjoying the Corner Bakery\'s seasonal salads, pizzas, panini, pastas and sandwiches like roasted vegetables on caramelized onion focaccia, chopped chicken in a pesto mayonnaise, turkey-swiss with mustard mayonnaise, tomato mozzarella, roast beef with cheddar cheese or red onions and stone-ground mayo. Thirty kinds of bread available at any time. Pecan chicken salad and Asian cucumber salad. Maple pecan bars, tiramisu pound cake and banana caramel bars are just a few of the desserts, along with a variety of cookies. Affordable and quick.The location outside of South Coast Plaza is combined with Maggiano\'s and it is confusing to figure out the logistics of dining there. And the name \'bakery\' is not entirely accurate, except for the good selection of breads, which are baked at a central commissary. There\'s more: The store in Orange includes another entirely different concept, a pizza restaurant, with pizzas that are different from the other Corner Bakery pizzas, which have different kinds of crusts at each location, either. Consistency? Uh, uh. They like to think of it as \'variety.\' Full bar at the location that is adjacent to Maggiano\'s; the other two locations serve wine and beer only.

properties.name: Darya Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 1611 W Sunflower Ave Ste E59, Santa Ana, CAAcross the street from South Coast Plaza is Orange County\'s most elegant Persian restaurant. Marble columns, decadent chandeliers and elegant private rooms make Darya a favorite among locals. Lunch is considerably less expensive and perfect for a business meeting, but dinner is a dining experience. With a piano playing in the background, start with some Dolemeh (cooked grape leaves filled with beef, rice and vegetables), hummus and Panir Sabzi (feta cheese, walnuts and fresh herbs). Since Persian dining is typically a family affair, these starters are all perfect for sharing, or sampling. The entrÃ©e menu is extensive, including chicken, seafood, beef, lamb and vegetarian plates. Stand out dishes include the boneless lamb kebab marinated in Darya sauce, Naderi Kebab (chunks of filet mignon marinated with basmati rice) and combination platters such as the lamb chop, filet mignon and shrimp version. Dessert brings tasty treats such as baklava and Persian ice cream. -- Victoria Namkung

properties.name: Delicias de Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  13466 Harbor Blvd, Garden Grove, CA714-636-7163 While we\'re used to ice cream flavors like the standard vanilla and chocolate, it\'s at Delicias de Mexico in Garden Grove where the brave can really venture out and try a surprising array of flavors, from a scoop made from the tropical Mamay fruit, to a corn flavored "paleta de leche," or ice cream bar. A standout in this store is the Chongos ice cream, which is like tried and true vanilla ice cream with a twist: There\'s a hint of cinnamon in each spoonful, along with tiny, chewy flecks of sweet curded milk candy. On this hot day, the Chongos ice cream didn\'t even have time to melt before we wolfed it down. And while this place has by far some of the most creative ice cream flavors, it does right by us in the standard flavors as well. Cookies and cream is a tasty surprise, with a sweet, soft vanilla flavor countered by crunchy, almost salty chocolate cookies. Out of all the scoops of cookies and cream we ate, Delicias de Mexico\'s was the favorite.

properties.name: Diho Siam
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 1835 Newport Boulevard, Costa Mesa, CA, 92627Authentic Thai and Chinese cuisine are served here. Open since 1998. This restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating available. A popular place for business lunch.

properties.name: Downey Quick Print
properties.description: Posted by System10025 Tecum Road, Downey, CA, 90240Downey Quick Print 562562877-927927827-441421977468

properties.name: El Campeon
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 580 W 19th Street, Costa Mesa, CA, 92627The San Juan Capistrano location has counter seating augmented by some outdoor tables on Sundays. Costa Mesa has indoor tables. No frills at either place. Crowd: Everybody. Pickup trucks to Rolls Royces. Food: The cuisine of central Mexico, more specifically from the state of Michoacan. Just call it the \'Home Of The \'T\'s:\' Tacos, tamales, tortas, tortillas, tacquitos and tostadas are just the beginning. A huge steam-table groans with menudo, chicken soup (caldo de pollo), beef soup (caldo de res), goat soup (birra), and trays of fried pork (carnitas), barbecued pork (al pastor) tongue, brains, pork stomach, pork skin and something called \'cabeza.\' (Don\'t ask.) Tamer taste buds will enjoy the chicken fajitas, pork and hominy soup (posole), chile verde, chile rojo and the house\'s fabulous chicken in chocolate sauce (mole ranchero). Cool down with one of the aguas fresca (watermelon, mango, banana, strawberry, etc.) and sample the excellent sweet corn tamales. Both strawberry and pineapple tamales are made daily. Corn tortillas are made on the premises, with the corn ground right there. Great salsas and guacamole, as well as homemade flan and rice pudding. And, yes, you can huevos at breakfast time. Highs and Lows: In an authenticity league of its own. Picks up where the others leave off. Not at all \'Americanized.\' Shopping for groceries? Check out the meat market next door to the San Juan location. Ingredients for everything prepared in the restaurant can be purchased here. The only low is that there needs to be one of these in every town. Service: Counter service only. Speedy and efficient. Family business operated by seven siblings since 1996. Wine and Beverages: Soft drinks and aguas fresca only. Coffee and iced tea. Value: A dream come true.

properties.name: El Torito Grill
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 633 Anton Boulevard, Costa Mesa, CA, 92626Bustling, festive and spacious, each with a lively bar. The main event is a stainless steel comal, on which fresh tortillas are grilled to blistering perfection all day. Crowd: Business bunch from nearby stores and offices. Food: Upscale, yuppified Mexican cuisine. Delicious, fresh tortillas are offered with orange-honey butter and two fresh salsas. Signature dishes include guacamole prepared tableside, blackened tamarind calamari fajitas, pasta with blackened chicken breast, mesquite grilled shrimp with fresh basil on a skewer served over rice and jalapeno corn and a wonderful salad of mesquite grilled chicken breast on a heart of romaine with a creamy cilantro pepita dressing. Desserts include flan and fried ice cream Highs and Lows: The homemade flour tortillas. Great Sunday brunch buffet. Best pico de gallo in town. In some of the restaurant\'s business-area locations, valet parking is not just an option, it is a necessity. Service: Excellent Wine and Beverages: Full bar. Wine and beer. Top-of-the-line tequilas. Value: Superb

properties.name: Embassy Suites Santa Ana - Orange County Airport North
properties.description: Posted by Baobot1325 East Dyer Rd., Santa Ana, CA, United StatesConveniently located 1 1/2 miles from the John Wayne Airport, the Embassy Suites offers amenities for work and play: high-speed internet access, a business center, a fitness center, pool and whirlpool. Guests stay in spacious two-room suites fully equipped with two televisions, a refrigerator, microwave oven, coffee maker, two telephones with data ports and a well lit dining/work table. Guests also receive a complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast, and can enjoy a nightly manager\'s reception.

properties.name: Express Business Machines
properties.description: Posted by System, Cypress, CAExpress Business Machines (714) 952-3148

properties.name: Ferdussi
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 3605 S. Bristol St., Santa Ana, CA, 92704It\'s all about the buffet at this Persian spot near South Coast Plaza. Business people, locals and even Angelenos come in droves to sample everything from basmati rice to fessenjon (chicken in sweet and sour pomegranate-walnut sauce). Shekam pareh is fresh eggplant covered with ground beef and garlic and maust esfenage is a creamy yogurt sauce that goes great with chicken or the pita bread. The interior is elegant and roomy booths are romantic at night. If you\'re ordering off the menu, the seasoned lamb shank is a favorite and the chicken shish kabobs are tender. Most chicken and meat dishes are marinated in saffron and cooked over an open flame. A full bar and music on Fridays and Saturdays keep the atmosphere lively. Friendly servers and low prices (lunch buffet is .99) keep customers coming back for more. Persian tea and honey-coated desserts top things off nicely. - - Victoria Namkung

properties.name: Franco's Pasta Cucina
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 2222 Michelson Dr Ste 206, Irvine, CA 92612Franco\'s is located inside a busy food court serving the lunch crowd. I used to come here when I worked in the area. They serve salmon, clam, feta, and yellowtail with rigatoni, fettucine, linguine, and gnocchi.

properties.name: French's Cupcake Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar273 E. 17th Street, Costa Mesa, CA 92627Family owned and operated by Jerry and Dianne French. They offer a mind-boggling range of cakes, and most of their cakes are one of a kind. We got birthday cakes from them from the past and they were simply delicious!

properties.name: Fullerton Municipal Airport
properties.description: Posted by Baobot4011 W. Commonwealth Ave., Fullerton, CA, United StatesMunicipal airport for private aircraft. On-site businesses include flight schools, fueling stations and airplane hangars.

properties.name: Gabbi's Mexican Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Baobot141 S. Glassell St., Orange, CA, United StatesSeating is either inside in a dark, deep, narrow dining room or on a small patio that sits along Glassell. If the weather is comfortable, hope for an outside table, especially if you catch it at that time of day when the sun is wilting away and the first moments of evening arrive with an embracing breeze. There may not be a better table in the county at that moment. Particularly if you have before you Panuchos de Yucatan, essentially three sliders of perfect chunks of pork on tortillas, an icy margarita and ceviche, a bowl of unrestrained flavor, full of tart citrus, sweet mango, bite of fish, red onion and cilantro. If you forgo the margarita, do not deny yourself the horchata here. It\'s sweet, creamy and full of cinnamon. Be warned, they do run out. (Reviewed in The Orange County Register Sept. 21, 2006, by Tenny Tatusian).

properties.name: German Home Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 2950 Grace Lane, Costa Mesa, CA, 92626German down to its toes (if restaurants had toes), this charming little cafe-deli, located on a side street off Costa Mesa\'s busy Baker Ave., is one of Orange County\'s hidden treasures. For starters, there\'s a little German market inside, where you can buy European candies and sundries. Then there\'s the bakery itself, with glass cases temptingly showing off glistening apple strudels, many flavors of Danishes, cookies (try the "Amerikaners" -- half-dipped in chocolate)and cakes (they specialize in wedding cakes here, by the way). THEN there are the sandwiches. Stop in for lunch or an early dinner and pick from any of the luscious home-baked breads (rye or pumpernickle are our faves), stuffed with ham, corned beef, or any combo of dozens of meats and cheeses. Specials are offered regularly. You can get it all to take out, but we like to eat at one of the little tables inside, where you can hear the ladies behind the counter speak German to their regular customers, and where you can browse one of the many German newspapers and magazines offered for your perusal. At Christmastime, don\'t miss the home-baked stollen (German sweet bread studded with fruit and topped with powdered sugar -- they must sell thousands of them!) and the ornately decorated gingerbread men, women and hearts.

properties.name: Golden Dragon
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 2023 Harbor Blvd, Suite A, Costa Mesa, CA, 92626Matriarchal restaurateur Chi Wang and Number One Son John run the front of the house, while Wang\'s husband Yuander is the chef at this esteemed establishment. With huge portions of superior caliber food and reasonable prices, this generous-spirited restaurant has been a Wang family affair in Costa Mesa for more than two decades. Crab and cream cheese toast is a unique creation that makes the appetizer list here shine. Peking duck (which is actually an appetizer when offered as part of a special Chinese feast), is another Crispy shrimp with honey-glazed walnuts, pan-fried chicken with a sweet and spicy orange peel sauce, Peking duck and large spicy scallops cooked with vegetables and a Chinese hot pepper sauce are standouts on the entree list. Large parties are accommodated easily here, and the Wangs do a brisk business at both lunch and dinner. Another unusual touch: fresh fruit is often available, according to the season. Fried apples or bananas, ordered in advance at the time you make your reservation, are prepared tableside. It\'s a good idea to let them know ahead of time (24 hours ahead of time) if you want to have Peking duck, as well. Servers are attired in tuxedos, and there is always a family member at the door to greet guests and make them feel welcomed (and important). Possibly more than anything, it\'s the graciousness that keeps customers coming back year after year. In 2001, the Southern California Restaurant Writers Association, of which I am a member, recognized Mrs. Wang\'s dedication to the culinary arts by naming her "Restaurateur Of The Year."

properties.name: Growers Direct
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  101 E 17th St., Costa Mesa, CA 92627Growers Direct is located by the Triangle Square shopping center (oxymoron), in a messy tangle of streets (known as the "Bermuda Triangle") where the 55 freeway turns into Newport. It\'s small market mostly known by locals that sells fresh and seasonal produce at "cheap" prices that you\'d normally find at Asian or Mexican grocery stores.

properties.name: Hamburger Mary's Bar & Grille
properties.description: Posted by Baobot4221 Dolphin-Striker Way, Newport Beach, CA, United StatesBusiness and domestic partners Stan Sax and Darren Woolsey bring their gay-friendly franchise to Orange County. This feels like Red Robin meets Laguna Beach\'s Boom Boom Room. There are wide booths, a spacious stage, and a lounge area lorded over by fishnet-covered mannequin legs. A mirrored disco ball adds pizzazz to the communal washroom sinks. On a Monday night visit in December, the 8,400-square-foot restaurant attracted diverse customers, from co-ed groups of office co-workers to slender, faux-hawked college-age male couples. The first Hamburger Mary\'s restaurant opened in 1972 in San Francisco\'s SoMa district. Opened Dec. 7, 2005.

properties.name: Hicks Canyon Trail
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   This trail is right outside of the private residental community where I live. It is accessible from the inside along the corridors, as well as from the outside at Hicks Canyon Park or Citrusglen Park. The original trail was the road from nowhere to nowhere through orange groves (since replaced by houses) and is a favorite jogging trail of many local residents. This may be the least noisy trail in town with few busy streets (and none that you have to cross) and no freeways nearby. Pungent eucalyptus trees line most of the trail and provide shade in the afternoon.

properties.name: Hilton Anaheim
properties.description: Posted by Baobot777 W. Convention Way, Anaheim, CA, United StatesLocated next to the Anaheim Convention Center. Features a 25,000-square-foot spa and fitness center, indoor basketball court, business center and twin ballrooms that create 60,000 square feet of room for various events.

properties.name: Huntington Beach Public Library
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   7111 Talbert Avenue, Huntington Beach, CA 92648A large public library with cozy reading spots, sound proof booths, eating area, and conference rooms. I used to study here quite a bit during my high school years.

properties.name: Infosys Business Solutions
properties.description: Posted by Yahoolocal10073 Valley View St, #122, Cypress, CAInfosys Business Solutions (714) 821-4663

properties.name: Islands
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 4020 Barranca Pkwy, Irvine, CA, 92604The first Islands was started in West LA in 1982. It has since grown to 27 restaurants in Southern California. This upscale, casual dining chain offers gourmet hamburgers, soft tacos, and fresh salads in a sort of funky tropical/surfer atmosphere. Islands serves generous portions at reasonable prices. Their specialties are the hamburgers, which are appropriately named after popular surf terms such as "Big Wave", "Pipeline", "Makaha", and "Sunset". And don\'t forget to try their french fries. One order is generally enough for the whole table (2 lbs of fresh cut taters with the skins on). The soft tacos, chicken sandwiches, and salads are also very tasty. There is also a special menus for "Gremmies" (the surfer term for kids) that is priced around .00. Service is very good, but don\'t be surprised to wait during peak hours, they get busy due to their popularity. They also offer a full service bar, naturally offering vacation drinks such as Mai Tai\'s, Pina Colada\'s, and other umbrella favorites.

properties.name: Jamillah Garden
properties.description: Posted by Jpowell74 2512 Walnut Ave, Tustin, CA

properties.name: Jeffrey Open Space Trail
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   10601 Jeffrey Rd, Irvine, CA 92602Bordering the east side of Jeffrey Road, the Jeffrey Open Space Trail is a recreation and open space corridor park that will span Irvine\'s entire north-south length. This rare community amenity will make it possible for residents (if they\'re so inclined and can muster the stamina) to bicycle, jog or walk, literally, from one end of the city to the other. As envisioned in concept, the trail will ultimately link up with trails leading deep into the vast preserved wildlands north and south of the city. Thus, a unique sage to sea outdoor experience will emerge. The trail will feature a dual trail system: an 11-foot-wide paved trail for bicyclists, and a parallel five-foot-wide unpaved path for joggers and walkers. At numerous points, the trail will pass through cool wooded areas and open to small and large parks and grassy meadows. At these picturesque junctures, residents will be able to enjoy picnics, kite flying and other passive recreational activities.

properties.name: John Wayne Airport
properties.description: Posted by BaostarJohn Wayne Airport has one of the shortest runways, at 5,701 feet, restricting its commercial use to aircraft no larger than a Boeing 757. The short runway length, combined with noise restrictions, requires an unusual takeoff at or near full power, with a steep climb followed by a sudden reduction in power and a sharp turn.

properties.name: Koi Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 600 Pacific Coast Hwy #100, Seal Beach, CA, United StatesThis top-quality, family-run restaurant has been in business for 26 years and never skimps on quality. The daily fresh fish selection is extensive and diverse, offering top-of-the-line specialties not found in run-of-the-mill sushi restaurants (try the different types of mackerel and snapper). The sake menu is excellent, with a diverse selection of offerings. (Iris Yokoi)

properties.name: Laxmi Sweets & Spices
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  638 El Camino Real, Tustin, CALike most Indian markets, this one assaults your sense of smell before any other sense. The sleepy market is pungent with the aroma of curry, turmeric, fenugreek and cardamom, all draping around you like six yards of a sari. Laxmi has been around for 16 years and exists as a small temple of cluttered, unmanicured hominess stocked with English teas, sacks of jasmine rice, frozen meals of curry and a thriving selection of Indian movies and CDs. Pass all this by and walk to the back where a short buffet is ready every day around 11 a.m. The lamb curry is tender, vegetable meatballs sit in a creamy yellow gravy, rolled chickpea crackers are wonderful snacks. Maybe the lentil soup is too watery, but the naan, charred in spots, is never insipid. There are battered and fried potatoes that are perfectly creamy inside. And the pakoras, lentil fritters, are smooth and spicy. All this requires a sweet ending. The rice pudding is milky and flavored with cinnamon and cardamom and fat raisins. The gulab jamun are deep-fried dumplings tasting vaguely of sweetened condensed milk soaking in simple syrup. You can also fill up on plain lassi or mango lassi, both are thick, creamy slushies made from yogurt. There\'s also a vast menu of Indian specialties, including parathas (stuffed pan-roasted wheat breads), outstanding biryanis (a pile of saffron-yellow rice flecked with spices and mixed with tender lamb or chicken), and vegetarian dishes such as baingan bharta (lucious eggplant simmered with onions and cinnamon) and aloo-poori (spicy potatoes served with deep-fried whole wheat bread). You\'ll be shocked by the length of dosas - they\'ll seem like baseball bats. The large, diaphanous crepe is rolled around a filling of spicy potato and served with two sauces, one is made of coconut, the other tart and bright red from tomato. On the same plate is a dark pickle that\'s as assaulting as anything you\'ve evertasted. The tika masala is one of a few dishes where spices take a back seat to a sweet, creamy gravy. It\'s excellent with either lamb or chicken. Someone in the kitchen here is making this soul food with imprecision, and yet, it\'ll sink permanently into your psyche. -ocregister

properties.name: Lazy Dog
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 16310 Beach Blvd, Huntington Beach, CA, 92683One thing\'s for sure: The dawgs behind this new Huntington Beach hot spot are anything but lazy. Owner Chris Simms and his father/business partner Tom put a whole lot of time, effort and entrepreneurial razzle-dazzle into the place, and it shows. Of course, it doesn\'t hurt matters any that both Simms have been running successful restaurants for years (Chris has opened several PF Changs locations, while Tom founded and still owns the Mimi\'s Cafe chain). Lazy Dog is their (ahem) pet project -- and a rare crossbreed it is. Both the decorative motif and the menu are classic American with European and Asian twists. Black-and-white photos of China adorn one wall; color photos of the employees\' pets hang on another. Comfortable booths, a fireplace and vibrant murals make the main room seem warm despite its stone walls and high ceilings. The bar scene is lively: The bartenders mix up Otter Pops, Rose Laker Shakers and other specialty cocktails as fast as folks can drink \'em. Comfort cuisine classics such as the meatloaf and "inside out" quesadilla hit the spot. Even vegetarians are assured of a good meal, as the chef is more than able to make veggie versions of most of the menu items. -- Lena Katz

properties.name: Los Alamitos Army Airfield
properties.description: Posted by Baobot11200 Lexington Ave., Los Alamitos, CA, United StatesLos Alamitos AAF is a restricted area - fenced, gated and patrolled 24 hours a day. Access is limited to official business. Visitors and passengers must contact operations for access.

properties.name: Lucca Cafe & Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  6507 Quail Hill Parkway, Irvine, CA, 92603The story on Lucca is Corona del Mar residents, Cathy and Elliot Pavlos, wanted to share their love of food and cooking that is inspired by Cathy\'s grandmother\'s cooking and her favorite restaurants in Italy, France and Greece. Lucca serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner in an upscale yet casual setting with art-inspired decor. Lucca uses only fresh, quality ingredients, including local, seasonal produce and many organic products. They serve bread from La Brea and Buona Forchetta Bakeries, as well as Lavazza Coffee. The restaurant also has more than 30 wines by the glass. The lunch menu has a selection of pasta, including Penne with Grilled Asparagus and Leeks, and Linguine with Shrimp Diavolo. Lucca\'s house specialties, include Ravioloni Aperti (a large, single open ravioli stuffed with grilled chicken and spinach in a pesto sauce with a light touch of bechamel, and dusted with Parmesano Reggiano), Lasagne Vegetale (Vegetarian Lasagna filled with Zucchini, Eggplant and Spinach, light fresh herbed ricotta filling and marinara sauce), and Lasagne Bolognese (the chef\'s family recipe; a traditional Meat Lasagna with a light bechamel sauce.) Dinner is more European-bistro like, where they serve small plates (about half the portion you\'d get in another restaurant) that you can share with others. The food is high-quality and simple. The salmon is wild, the tri-tip is certified Angus, most of the fruits and vegetables are organic and the scallops are from New England.

properties.name: Marco Polo Italian Eatery
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 1260 Bison Street, Newport Beach, CA, 92660Open trattoria with antiqued walls and display kitchen. Also features a woodburning oven. Crowd: A marvelous neighborhood place in a nice neighborhood. Breathes life onto an otherwise dull strip mall. Lots of regulars from Newport North, Belcourt, Spyglass, Newport Coast and Big Canyon. A business crowd also comes from nearby offices. Food: Freshly made pastas, with everything made to order. Customers like that they can add or subtract ingredients, which is the true test of a good restaurant. Pastas, seafood, steaks, daily specials. One of the best items on the menu is the chicken focaccia pannini, which layers grilled chicken, grilled bell peppers, sautÃ©ed mushrooms, Mozzarella cheese and homemade vinaigrette dressing onto freshly baked focaccia bread. Try the cioppino. Highs and Lows: A breath of fresh air in an area that has few restaurants. And this is not some cookie-cutter corporate enterprise. For many customers it is a second home. No lows, only highs. Service: Superb. Wine and Beverages: Everything from a 2 Chianti to an 0 Brunello. Value: The high quality of a fine dinner house in a casual setting, and at reasonable prices.

properties.name: Martin Aviation Hangar
properties.description: Posted by Baobot19300 Ike Jones Rd., Santa Ana, CA, United StatesAviation company offering business jet maintenance.

properties.name: Martini Blues
properties.description: Posted by Baobot5874 Edinger Avenue, Huntington Beach, CA, United StatesMartini Blues Supper Club opened its doors almost 5 years ago and quickly began growing into one of the premiere music scenes in Orange County. The three performance areas and bar thread together with a rich blues and jazz motif- dark woods, mood lighting and paintings of Ella and Frank give the feeling of going back in time - to when going out was an event itself. An elegant bar mixed with all the fun of a nightclub creates a night out that simply must be experienced.

properties.name: MicroCenter
properties.description: Posted by Baobot1100 East Edinger Ave., Tustin, CA, United StatesRetail store selling thousands of computer products including hardware, software, upgrades, accessories and books.General Information:(714) 566-8500Business Services:(800) 743-7537Fee-based Technical Support:1-800-207-3434Job Applications:(714) 566-8500

properties.name: Mil Jugos
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 318 W 5th St, Santa AnaA tiny Venezuelan restaurant in downtown Santa Ana on Fifth Street between Ross and Broadway. The name translates into 1,000 juices, but in reality, you have a choice of about 20 fruit juices. Yet the juices aren\'t really the story here. Go for the arepas or cachapas. The arepas look like whoopi pies: round pale corn cake domes stuffed with shredded beef or chicken or thick slices of tender, wine-marinated eye-of-round steak. The cachapas are thick folded sweet pancakes stuffed with the same, except my favorite is a simple filling of cheese and cream. The tres leches cake is ethereal, rich and spiced with cinnamon.

properties.name: Ministry Business Service
properties.description: Posted by Yahoolocal6451 Ringo Cir, Huntington Beach, CAMinistry Business Service (714) 840-5900

properties.name: Monkey Business General Store and Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baobot   301 E. Amerige Ave., Fullerton, CA, United StatesGeneral store portion offers gifts, school supplies and household items.Cafe serves breakfast, coffee, blended drinks, smoothies, fresh juices, salads and sandwiches.

properties.name: Nick's Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 2300 Harbor Boulevard, Costa Mesa, CA, 92626Nick yells a lot, mostly at his son, Joey. Nick is a character, and the customers love him. Joey and his mom, Lisa, makes Nick stay at home to work on the family farm in Temecula a couple of days a week. Crowd: Blue- and white-collar workers at lunch; neighborhood folks at dinner. Food: You have to taste the sage, basil, rosemary, eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers and tomatoes Nick grows on his Temecula farm, and you can whenever you order a sausage sandwich with fresh roasted peppers, or any of the incredible oversized pizzas that come with vegetable toppings. Homemade raviolis are over the edge, especially the ones filled with lobster. Wonder why Nick\'s is always so crowded? Food that tastes like this doesn\'t stay a secret for long. Highs and Lows: Best pizza toppings and best pizza crust ANYWHERE. But try finding it, if you don\'t know where it is. Harbor Center is the name of this bustling new strip mall, which replaced the faded old one. You\'ll see Nick\'s with its bright new sign at the north edge of the parking lot. And it is BUSY. Service: Warm and friendly. Wine and Beverages: Beer and wine. Value: Doggie bags are the norm.

properties.name: Northpark Plaza
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 3901 Irvine Blvd., Irvine, CA 92602A plaza outside my home where you can find me sitting outside of Champagne Bakery sipping a cup of coffee and a jesuit. Store Listing: Albertsons 714-734-5655 Celebrity Cleaners 714-734-6790 Century 21 714-505-1220 Champagne French Bakery Cafe 714-573-4667 Chevron 714-731-2377 Chipotle Mexican Grill 714-508-2463 Commercial Capital Bank 714-505-1097 Countrywide Home Loans Coming Soon CVS Pharmacy 714-368-0991 Cynthia\'s Hallmark 714-368-9662 Donut Star 714-368-0045 Fantastic Sams 714-508-0791 Firehouse Char Grill 714-731-5818 H&R Block 714-730-8074 Hair,Health & Beauty 714-573-9987 Happy Nails & Spa 714-731-2933 Irvine Veterinary Services 714-573-1890 Jack In The Box 714-832-4590 Jade Palace 714-508-7978 Juice it Up 714-838-5458 Northpark Dental Associates 714-368-3319 Northpark Optometry Postal Annex 714-508-1838 Round Table Pizza 714-508-9800 Starbucks Coffee 714-734-9757 Subway 714-505-2284 Sushinoya 714-508-1668 Tony\'s Tailoring and Men\'s Wear 714-838-9335 Washington Mutual 714-731-3060

properties.name: Northpark Village
properties.description: Posted by Baostar    A private residential community where I live, situated within 60-year-old strands of eucalyptus windrows, and align to give homes beautiful views of the foothills. It\'s a 275-acre community with 1600 homes, 11 private parks, 6 swimming pools, tennis courts, clubhouse, and other amenities. There are a variety of architecture styles reminiscent of "Classic California" neighborhoods such as Pasadena, San Marino, Santa Monica, and so on. You\'ll find that all the streets are named after different places in California...and the pools...and the parks. Hicks Canyon Elementary School is adjacent to the community so kids can actually walk to school without going outside the neighborhoods. Right outside is Hicks Canyon public park where parents usually watch baseball and soccer games; there are biking trails that lead to the foothills on both sides; and a local shopping center. The community is also very pedestrian and dog-friendly - residents like to walk to the grocery store, or their dogs, or kids in strollers at anytime of the day. 1/2 block away is my favorite coffee shop, Champagne Bakery, and 1 1/2 block away is my favorite bookstore.

properties.name: Official Meeting House of The Kings x93x
properties.description: Posted by WildgiftThis is the last known location of The Kings street gang\'s meeting house. The Kings, aka Breakfast Kings, aka Burger Kings, aka the Not-Have-Nots are notorious for controlling the Heights with an iron fist (and lots of small caliber ammo) and for extorting the local residents for "taxes" to pay for "security" from the rival gangs (especially the rivals in the flats, the Little Kings, aka Lunch Kings, aka Dairy Queens). Also, the gangs are rivals in the real estate business. Be careful. Better yet, stay away.

properties.name: Omni Machine Corp.
properties.description: Posted by Chiiquitaa9722 Jordancircle santa fe springsm Ca. 90670My husbands business.

properties.name: One Good Summer
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  Fountain Valley, CAMy earliest memory as a child was swimming in public pools with my father. As I grew up, my friends and I would float at night in swimming pools the temperature of blood; pools the color of Earth as seen from outer space. We would spend our summer days and nights bathed in chlorine - lit by the pure blue lights installed underneath diving boards. I used to think that the heat would suck every last drop from your swimming pool or redden our skins until it had the hue of raw flesh. I remembered you saying... And some people like summer. "Have a great summer," their yearbook inscriptions bellow happily, as if they actually want me to enjoy myself, as if they actually would notice if I imploded in front of them. But with graduation here and the fact that I will probably never see any of my school mates again hovering in my brain, I can honestly say that I am going to have the best summer of my life and even my new manager at work can\'t stop me. So here\'s to you being able to fling your problems away like the fleas off a dog\'s back and by the way, have a great summer.

properties.name: Orange County Financial Services Coalition
properties.description: Posted by Baobot2415 E. Imperial Highway, Brea, CA, United StatesBusiness group made of real estate agents, title companies, attorneys and loan officers.The group hosts multiple events during the year to network and share business ideas.

properties.name: Original Pancake House
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 1418 E. Lincoln Ave., Anaheim, CAA nearly overwhelming menu of pancakes, Belgian waffles and omelettes, all prepared perfectly (and good coffee, too!).

properties.name: Pacific Beach Club site
properties.description: Posted by Spaceagecity   Huntington Beach, CA 92646The Pacific Beach Club was a large private beach resort for black people which was burned to the ground under mysterious circumstances just shortly before opening for business in 1926. Today, the site is part of Huntington State Beach, between Newland St. and Beach Blvd.

properties.name: Panera Bread Bakery Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baobot  1348 Bison Ave., Newport Beach, CA, 92660Blue Plate Special: Gourmet sandwiches and paninis made on the signature artisan bread. Or just the bread itself: stone-milled rye, Kalamata olive, sunflower and many more. Espresso drinks and pastries are also popular options. The Dish: When Midwesterners crave a roast beef and smoked cheddar sandwich on fresh-baked Asiago cheese bread or a turkey artichoke panini, this is where they go. Widely known in the heartland for its fresh-baked artisan breads and delicious pastries, the bakery chain is in the process of expanding to the West Coast. Several locations are opening in 2003-04, most of them in California. Outstanding baked goods and heart-healthy recipes should make it an instant favorite with Left Coast denizens. The Scene: Spacious, upscale and handsomely decorated, these bakeries are a favorite for breakfast, lunch, a light dinner or a quick snack. All kinds of people frequent them, from health gurus to self-styled food critics to hungry families. The dining area is usually quite pleasant, though during the lunch rush it can get overly crowded. The restaurants also do quite a bit of takeout business. Every day, the stone-deck ovens in the kitchen turn out nine different kinds of artisan bread. -- Lena Katz

properties.name: Papa Hassan's
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 421 S. Glassell St., Orange, CAA favorite of students, professors and local business folk since 1977. Brothers Mahmoud Haidar and Mustafa Hassan continue to sling out creamy hummus, fluffy rice, juicy kabobs and comforting casseroles at astonishing prices. Daily specials range from to and include soup or salad. Or you can order a sandwich - spicy potato or shawarma, for instance - for tops. If you find yourself with a little extra cash, don\'t think twice about ordering a beguiling dessert of sweet pudding on a thin layer of drenched bread tasting of milk and honey they call, appropriately enough, "heaven."

properties.name: Pascal Epicerie
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 1000 Bristol Street N., Newport Beach, CA, 92660The frugal French housewife in the kitchen is really highly-acclaimed chef Pascal Olhats, who could be charging a lot more money for his food. He and his wife, Mimi, want their customers to feel like family when they dine here, and they\'re doing a wonderful job. Straight out of downtown France, this is where famed caterer, who operates a fine restaurant next door, sells a selection of gourmet products, olive and truffle oils and sets out a Parisian smorgasbord for a very gentle price. Crowd: Foodies. Food: Whether you\'re in the mood for an afternoon repast at one of the tables or have stopped in to take home some of these beautiful foodstuffs, Pascal and Mimi Olhats\' little charcuterie/deli is a foodie\'s dream. Deli cases display French cheeses, house-cured olives, quiches, tiny onion and tomato tarts, beet salad, salad Nicoise with fresh albacore tuna, lamb osso bucco, and seabass with a thyme crumb topping. Many items, including salads, are sold by the pound, so feel free to mix and match. I\'m partial to the lamb sandwich with butter lettuce on walnut bread. Picnic baskets (5 - 5.99) can be ordered 48 hours in advance. Look under \'desserts\' in the dictionary and you\'ll see a picture of Pascal. Lovely lemon tarts, fresh fruit tarts, chocolate ganache tortes, creme brulees and chocolate raspberry cake are just a few of the choices. Most are just a little bit bigger than bite-sized but larger sizes are available, too. All to eat in or take out. Highs and Lows: Extraordinary level of food preparation. Some guesswork is involved when you\'re ordering \'a little of this and a little of that\' at lunch. And what happened to the light-as-air Napoleons? Pout. Service: At the counter; stand in line when they\'re busy. Wine and Beverages: Beer and wine, and the prices are fine. Value: Terrific.

properties.name: Peacock Suites: Pretty Good For Anaheim
properties.description: Posted by Ourfounder 1745 S. Anaheim Blvd, anaheim, Ca 92805One of my largest and most beloved clients is in Anaheim, so I end up staying here often. I\'m still searching for someplace I like out here. The Peacock Suites is conveniently located near two exits on the 5, which is pretty much how one measure convenience in Orange County. Peacock Suites also has enforce valet parking for a day that they don\'t tell you about when you reserve a room. The people here have all been helpful and friendly - even when I switched from my previous and erroneous smoking room to my new non-smoking room. Two very nice things about this place. 1. The room safe is large enough to hold my very large laptop - in its bag. 2. The room has copious working free easily accessed wall plugs. Things other people might find nice. 1. HDTV 2. Full separation between the living and bed areas. 3. Judging by the number of children running up and down the halls, it must be kid friendly. The wifi here is 0 a day which is always annoying on business trips when you\'re only really in the room in the mornings, but it\'s important to get some personal work done.

properties.name: Phoenix Club
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 1340 S. Sanderson Ave., Anaheim, CA, United StatesThe Phoenix Club is a German-American cultural center in the heart of Orange County, California. Inspired by German heritage and traditions, the Phoenix Club has a European charm and warmth that has made it one of the most popular places in the region to gather for family fun, good food, and special events. The Phoenix Club is the largest German Club in Southern California - possibly in the United States - and offers many activities for its Members from Choir Singing and Dance Groups to Bowling and Soaring to Soccer and Table Tennis. We invite you to enjoy the amazing traditional German cuisine in the Loreley Restaurant and the Bier Stube and to join us at special events held throughout the year. Our beautiful grounds and facilities are often the site for business events and private parties and maybe even the site for your next event. We hope to see you soon. ---www.thephoenixclub.com

properties.name: Pico Rivera Center for the Arts
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 9200 Mines Ave., Pico Rivera, CA, United StatesOpened in 1989, the Pico Rivera Centre for the Arts features a 1,000 sq. ft. gallery exhibit space and classroom area for fine art classes. The Centre\'s fine art programs allow individuals to investigate all aspects of the arts including art production, art history, art criticism and aesthetics. A nurturing environment encourages individuals of all ages and skill levels to explore and enhance their creative abilities. Programs include: ?§ Five annual exhibitions featuring southern California artists ?§ Classes taught by local artists including painting, drawing, photography, ceramics, stained glass, calligraphy, tole painting, repujado and papel picado ?§ Annual Family Arts Day ?§ Lectures, workshops, film screenings and artist receptions ?§ Public programs in association with the Pico Rivera Arts & Culture Committee School and group visits may be made by calling (562) 801-4300. Centre staff are available during regular business hours Monday to Friday. ---www.ci.pico-rivera.ca.us

properties.name: Pleasant Peasant
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 4251 Martingale Way, Newport Beach, CA, 92660Warm and cozy, relaxed French country semi-casual establishment. Crowd: Local business people. Food: French bistro fare, including potato leek soup, onion soup, a vegetable and goat cheese Napoleon, sand dabs almondine, duck breast with blackberry sauce, leg of lamb, pasta stroganoff and meat loaf Wellington. Most ingredients are not terribly precious and frugal cuts of meat are treated to the art of the saucier. Highs and Lows: No-fuss menu at no-fuss prices. Soup or salad comes with all entrees. But it is hard to find unless you know exactly where it is. Service: Good. Wine and beer available. Value: Good.

properties.name: Pre-meeting dinner
properties.description: Posted by OurfounderTomorrow is an all-day business planning meeting for a consortium that Gray Hill Solutions is involved in. Most of us met tonight for a pre-event kick off at Wood Ranch. They had some pretty good bar-b-que. Not world class, but quite excellent for Southern California. I had the tri-tip for 7 which ended up being a very healthy portion.

properties.name: Prego Ristorante
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 18420 Von Karman, Irvine, CA, 92612Prego is tucked into a corporate business park in Irvine near the Irvine Marriott Airport Hotel. The food here is traditional Tuscan style Italian and the atmosphere and building are reminiscent of an Old World Italian trattoria. The main dining room features an exhibition kitchen where the authentic Italian specialties are prepared by the chefs. The extensive menu offerings include brick oven pizza, homemade pastas, spit-roasted chicken and duck, daily fresh fish selections and fabulous desserts. An extensive wine list features Italian and Californian wines and there is a full bar. Outdoor patio seating under a wisteria-covered loggia is also available.

properties.name: Rancho Alamitos High School
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  I met Mike Wallis at CASL competitions circa 1989 and we skated at some of his favorite skate spots one day. He took to me to an industrial area of Stanton where we skated a huge concrete half-pipe shaped loading dock. It is shaped like a cross between a "V" and a "U". It was a lot harder to skate because you have to use you weight to push yourself up and down the rough concrete terrain. Later, we went to Rancho Alamitos High School where there are manholes by the football field bleachers. These manholes are perfect for ollie grabs and other combos. I pulled an ollie impossible over a trash can here (if I remembered correctly) while Mike was doing Japan grabs (pictured).

properties.name: Sensasian
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 13290 Jamboree Road, Irvine, CA, 92602Before there was Pacific Rim or Asian fusion, there was Martin Yan, one of the original celebrity chefs. Yan hosted the popular TV show \'Yan Can Cook\' for 25 years and wrote several best-selling cookbooks. Now, after bringing his wok-savvy, health-conscious cooking to living rooms across America, he has opened a stylish, sexy, busy restaurant in the heart of Orange County. It\'s one of several restaurants in his new but rapidly growing empire. The extensive menu represents a broad spectrum of Asian regional flavors. To start, try the tempura ahi tuna rolls; they\'re a signature item. Other favorites include miso yaki sea bass, walnut shrimp, Macau roasted chicken and Korean barbecued lamb chops. The bar specializes in delicious Asian-inspired cocktails. If you work in the area, take advantage of the Marketplace lunch special Monday thru Friday. Sensasian also does happy hour twice, once after work Monday through Friday and one just before closing Sunday through Thursday. -- Lena Katz

properties.name: Taco Bell HQ
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 17901 Von Karman Ave, Irvine, CA 92614The founder of Taco Bell, Glen Bell, started with a hot dog stand in San Bernardino, California in 1946. After experimenting with alternative food items, he opened three Taco-Tia stands between 1954 and 1955, which he later sold to his partners. He then opened the first Taco Bell in Downey, California on March 21, 1962. The first Taco Bell franchise was sold in 1964 and the company went public in 1969. In 1978, Bell sold the chain to PepsiCo. The chain was spun off along with Pepsi\'s other fast food restaurant holdings as Tricon Global Restaurants in October 1997. Tricon became Yum! Brands, Inc. in May 2002. In the early 1990s, Taco Bell changed its menu due to pressure concerning the nutritional value of items labeled "Lite". It was believed the term lite was vague or possibly deceptive. Many of the items were dropped entirely from the menu; one such item was the "Taco Lite", a fried flour tortilla shell with beef, sour cream, lettuce, cheese and tomatoes. Some items were altered to change the nutritional values, such as the removal of black olives from the list of ingredients, in an effort to reduce sodium. In early 1995, Taco Bell transformed the familiar rainbow logo, in favor of a simpler pink/purple combo logo in an effort to revitalize their almost 20 year old logo. On April 1, 1996, Taco Bell took out a full-page advertisement in The New York Times announcing that they had purchased the Liberty Bell to "reduce the country\'s debt" and renamed it to "the Taco Liberty Bell." Thousands of people who did not immediately get the April Fool\'s Day hoax protested. In 2003, Costa Rican Taco Bell franchises temporary marketed their tacos as "Tacos ticos," because for Costa Ricans, the word "taco" refers to what is known in Mexico as a flauta. ("Tico" and "Costarrican" are colloqial terms for natives of Costa Rica.) In 2004, Taco Bell bought the naming rights to the Boise State Pavilion in Boise, Idaho and renamed the stadium the Taco Bell Arena. In 2004, PepsiCo and Taco Bell introduced Mountain Dew Baja Blast. The tropical-lime flavored drink is exclusive to Taco Bell stores. Along with this, Taco Bell introduced its Mountain Dew Viva Variety! promotional campaign, where a sign shows three cups of Mountain Dew, one normal, one Code Red and one Baja Blast. Added to the official menu in early 2006, the Crunchwrap Supreme is Taco Bell\'s latest permanent product. Their most recent "limited time only" item was the Chicken Caesar Grilled Stuft Burrito. In Canada, there were no Taco Bells in the province of Quebec before 2006. Priszm Brandz announced in April of that year that their first Quebec Taco Bell would open in suburban Montreal during the summer with 20 to 30 more to follow across the province. -wikipedia

properties.name: The Melting Pot
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 2646 Dupont Dr. Ste. C70, Irvine, CA 92612Designed to resemble a romantic American bistro one might have frequented in the \'70s when fondue first appeared on the trend scene, the room\'s color palate is made up of burnt oranges and avocado greens, the semi-private alcoves are dimly lit by retro fixtures and visible wine cases hearken back to a kitschier era. Diners may order a la carte, but the most popular method of eating here is through the pre-planned, four-course "Two on the Town" option, which keeps couples busy for several hours. This popular choice includes the traditional mixture of cheeses and rich sauces for appetizers and entrees while chocolates and caramels are presented for dessert. Not interested in a lengthy meal? The Melting Pot\'s bar has a wine list with over 100 unique vintages (and you can still sample the fondue there as well). -- Michael Alarcon (AOL City Guide)

properties.name: The Terrazza at Prego
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 18420 Von Karman Ave, Irvine, CA Prego Ristorante is inspired by the villas of the tuscan countryside. It has the warmth and rustic charm of old-world Italy with the electricity and vibrancy of a cosmopolitan restaurant. There\'s a Terrazza, or the Private Courtyard off the Main Dining Room shaded by a grapevine-laden trellis. The gentle splashing of nearby fountains lends a soothing sound, and the fountains themselves provide lovely backdrops for photographs. Couples getting married often reserve the entire restaurant so that they can take advantage of all its wonderful spaces.

properties.description: Posted by Baostar  18040 Culver Drive, Irvine, CAWholesome Choice offers American brands, plus an impressive line of Asian, Mediterranean, Russian, Eastern European, and even have South African foods. They have the natural and organic foods you\'ve come to expect, along with delicious market-fresh produce that arrives daily. There\'s a hearthstone bakery, located at the front of the store, where you can see speciality breads baked throughout the day. Their international food court caters to all cultures and all the locals can be typically seen eating in the dining area.

properties.name: Yaba Java
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 12908 Main St, Garden Grove, CA, 92840Supporting neighborhood businesses can feel like an obligation these days, but in some cases -- and Yaba Java is definitely one of them -- it\'s a pleasure. The little family-owned coffee shop has more specialty drinks than any of the big guns do, and it also offers a variety of non-coffee-based specialties. Try the Almond Roca Mocha, the chocolate-coconut iced blended, or any of the flavored hot chocolates, and your nerves will soon be a-buzz with epicurean delight (and caffeine). Pastries, sandwiches and bagels are available. However, for the truly self-indulgent, there\'s a whole selection of hand-dipped, homemade (in the proprietor\'s home, not in the store itself) chocolate treats. There are chocolate-covered almonds, marshmallows, graham crackers, maraschino cherries and more. The place is on the small side and cozy in that typical thrown-together, study-groups-welcome, casual, coffee-shop style. Board games are available, and you can usually scrounge up some reading material if you look around. In nice weather, the pretty outdoor patio is the place to be -- otherwise, try to snag the big leather sofa. If you\'re there on Friday night, you\'ll find yourself smack in the center of the Garden Grove Classic Car Show, which takes place weekly (weather permitting) on the Main Street historic strip right outside. -- Lena Katz

properties.description: Posted by Baostar 2424 W. Ball Road, Anaheim, CAIt\'s probably the best rotisserie chicken you\'ll ever find - the color of 24-carat gold, with crispy skin and tender meat. It comes with a pungent garlic paste that you\'ll taste for hours, if not days, afterward. Or try the great shawarma - both beef and chicken.

properties.name: Zov's Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 17440 E. 17th St., Tustin, CA, 92780Widely considered the best Mediterranean restaurant in Orange County, Zov Karamardian\'s namesake restaurant is part bistro, cafe and bakery. Breakfast selections include raisin brioche French toast, Belgian waffles, a panini sandwich and a smoked salmon omelette. The pastries are made on the premises and are available for takeout. The business crowd dominates at lunch and they love starting with warm pita and hummus, which precedes entrees like soujouk arrabbiata -- a spicy penne with Armenian sausage -- and a chicken tahini pita. Dinner is more formal and Babaganooj, a roasted, pureed eggplant with tahini and garlic is a great starter while main dishes include chicken geras, which is stuffed with wild rice, almonds and sour cherry sauce. There are plenty of seafood or vegetarian items on the menu as well, and a Sunday brunch that people swear by. Zov\'s offers cooking classes on certain nights and its catering business is booming. Customers here are loyal, but novelist Dean Koontz took it one step further and dedicated a book to Zov. -- Victoria Namkung
